title: Thomas Mort
text:
Thomas Mort (1 December 1897 – 6 June 1967) was an English footballer who played club football primarily for <a href="Aston%20Villa%20F.C.">Aston Villa</a>, as a <a href="left-back">left-back</a>. He also made three appearances for the <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England national team</a>.
Villa signed Mort from <a href="Rochdale%20A.F.C.">Rochdale</a> for £1,000 in 1922 and along with <a href="Tommy%20Smart">Tommy Smart</a>, was part of a defensive tandem known for Villa as "Death and Glory." He played 13 seasons with the club with 337 appearances. 
He was a cousin of <a href="Cardiff%20City%20F.C.">Cardiff City</a> defender <a href="Enoch%20Mort">Enoch Mort</a>.
